results.title: The History of inventions
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: Bozzetto claims that it was lightning that first showed man the wonders of fire and set him on the hazardous parth of invention. Since primitive times man’s inventive itch has never been at rest; now we find ourselves living on a planet so endangered by our inventions that we may well have to escape to another world to find the peace necessary to go on inventing. In Italian.

results.title: The History book. 5. Triumphant symphony
results.creator_credit: The Film Front and Tricontinental Film Center
results.brief_description:
Fifth in a series of nine animated films on the history of Western Civilization. Looks at the Industrial Revolution and some of its effects: the movement of people into the cities; the use of child labour; the exploitation of workers; the movement of capitalists into parliament to further their own interests and their use of police to quell the workers’ complaints; and the development of monopolies. English version by Tricontinental Film Center.
Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: The Historic route
results.creator_credit: Yemi Lijadu and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: Ethiopia has the most remarkable collection of monuments in the whole of Africa apart from the Mediterranean area, and the “historic route” is the richest in the country. The restoration and preservation of monuments as well as the development of sites are essential elements in the growth of tourism in the country’s economy.

results.title: The Hindu world
results.brief_description: An historical and cultural survey of Hinduism, set against a background of ancient temples and statues, and Hindu religious rites. Stresses the various mental and physical disciplines called yogas, through which Hindus seek eternal union with Brahma, the universal spirit of God. Also the caste system, the belief in reincarnation and the deep influences of the religion of the Hindu way of life.

results.title: The Highland Maya: a case study in economic anthropology
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “Faces of culture”.
Modern day Maya in the highlands of Mexico and Guatemala have fused the burdens of service to ancient gods and to the Christian God into the cargo system, during which a man must work his way up through four levels, paying out large amounts of money to the church, in order to gain prestige. Corn farming is no longer sufficient to pay the cargo, so that they often have to sell their labour to landowners far away from their homes. At the end of each year the cargo is passed to the next man and the next stage is undertaken.
results.title_for_label: The Highland Maya: a case study in economic anthropology
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston

results.title: The Highland heart of Nova Scotia
results.creator_credit: Ned Norwood, Margaret Perry and Nova Scotia Information Service
results.brief_description: Outlines history of Cape Breton Island, Nova Scotia highlighting French and Scottish influence on its development. Film depicts traditional music, dancing and crafts and features various places of interest including the Graham Bell Museum, Fort Louisberg, Cabot Trail, etc.

results.title: The Highest court
results.creator_credit: Daryl Dellora, Sue Maslin and Film Art Doco Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: The Highest Court in Australia is an enigma to many. There are sketches of insight which may be attributed to the publicity surrounding cases such as Mabo and Wik, however the mechanisms that have contributed to these decisions are often unknown. This video follows the handing down of two historic judgements; Kruger and Ha, and the appointment of two new Justices. By witnessing these events and processes the viewer is given an informative insight into the High Court and its operation. This documentary is produced by the same individuals who created the title “Mr Neal is entitled to be an agitator” (also in the collection).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daryl Dellora, Sue Maslin and Film Art Doco Pty Ltd

results.title: The High: drugs and you
results.brief_description: Three young people give insights into the drug scene - a personable student pusher, a teenager who has graduated from marijuana to speed and freaked out, and another who has tried hard drugs.

results.title: The Hidden world: a study of insects
results.creator_credit: Jack Haley, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how insects can be controlled to ensure human protection from illness. Shows how a bee tells other bees where to find flower nectar, and how winged termites are sent from one home colony to found new colonies.
